title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?
message: Hello, I'm working on a 820-3332-A. I see a torn pad on the ground pin of C8452. Can I just jump a wire to C8454's ground right next to it? Or do I need to find a separate ground not connected?

title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?

No Title

OH boy now I'm really screwed (hope not) I knocked off the PIN1 pad and I can't find a trace around it.  I think it goes directly down in the middle!  What can I do?  PIN 1 Goes to C5 of U8450.  Shit.  Don't see how to jump to that.  Am I screwed?

title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?
message: ground is ground dude, its all the same

title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?
message: Whew,  That' what I thought.  Ok dug down deep enough and found the copper underneath.  Used some sandpaper and some patience.  SOLVED!

title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?
message: Sandpaper? Just scrape off the Solder mask with Tweezers or a knife

title: [SOLVED] Torn GND pad. Can I jump a wire to other cap's ground?
